articles.title: Ambushed by AngularJS: a hidden CSP bypass in Piwik PRO

articles.description: Have you ever tested a Linux application that forks into multiple processes? Isn‚Äôt it a pain? Whether you‚Äôre debugging, trying to see a process crash, or trying to write an exploit, it can be super duper annoying! In a few days, I‚Äôm giving a talk at NorthSec in Montreal. I asked some co-workers to review my slides, and they commented that I have some neat techniques to deal with forking, so I thought I‚Äôd share a couple! Spoiler alert: The last one is the best, so you can just skip to that. :)
articles.title: Fork off: Three ways to deal with forking processes

articles.description: Lately, I‚Äôve been reverse engineering a reasonably complex network protocol, and I ran into a mystery - while the protocol is generally an unencrypted binary protocol, one of the messages was large and random. In an otherwise unencrypted protocol, why is one of the messages unreadable? It took me a few hours to accomplish what should have been a couple minutes of effort, and I wanted to share the trick I ultimately used! I‚Äôm going to be intentionally vague on the software, and even modify a few things to make it harder to identify; I‚Äôll probably publish a lot more on my work blog once I‚Äôm finished this project!
articles.title: Reverse engineering tricks: identifying opaque network protocols

articles.author: The ZDI Research Team
articles.description:
This post covers an exploit chain demonstrated by Nguy·ªÖn Ho√†ng Th·∫°ch (@hi_im_d4rkn3ss) of STAR Labs SG Pte. Ltd. during the Pwn2Own Vancouver event in 2023. During the contest, he used an uninitialized variable bug and a stack-based buffer overflow in VMware to escalate from a guest OS to execute code on the underlying hypervisor. His successful demonstration earned him $80,000 and 8 points towards Master of Pwn. All Pwn2Own entries are accompanied by a full whitepaper describing the vulnerabilities being used and how they were exploited. The following blog is an excerpt from that whitepaper detailing CVE-2023-20869 and CVE-2023-20870 with minimal modifications.
Prior to being patched by VMware, a pair of vulnerabilities existed within the implementation of the virtual Bluetooth USB device‚Ä¶
articles.title: CVE-2023-20869/20870: Exploiting VMware Workstation at Pwn2Own Vancouver

articles.author: Dustin Childs
articles.description:
It‚Äôs patch Tuesday once again, and Adobe and Microsoft have released their monthly batch of security updates. Take a break from your regularly scheduled activities and join us as we review the details of the latest offerings from Microsoft and Adobe. If you‚Äôd rather watch the video recap, you can check out the Patch Report webcast on our YouTube channel.
Adobe Patches for May 2023
For May, Adobe released a single bulletin for Substance 3D Painter addressing 11 Critical-rated and 3 Important-rated vulnerabilities. All of these bugs were found and reported by ZDI vulnerability researcher Mat Powell. The most severe of these issues would allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on an affected system if they can convince a user to open a specially-crafted file.
None of the bugs fixed by Ado‚Ä¶
articles.title: The May 2023 Security Update Review

articles.author: Trend Micro Research Team
articles.description:
In this excerpt of a Trend Micro Vulnerability Research Service vulnerability report, Guy Lederfein and Lucas Miller of the Trend Micro Research Team detail a recently patched remote code execution vulnerability in the Microsoft Windows DHCPv6 Service. This bug was originally discovered by YanZiShuang@BigCJTeam of cyberkl. The vulnerability results from the improper processing of DHCPv6 Relay-forward messages. A network-adjacent attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the DHCP service. The following is a portion of their write-up covering CVE-2023-28231, with a few minimal modifications.
A heap-based buffer overflow has been reported in Microsoft DHCPv6 Server. The vulnerability is due to improper processing of DHCPv6 Relay-forward messages. A remote atta‚Ä¶
articles.title: CVE-2023-28231: RCE in the Microsoft Windows DHCPv6 Service

Slides The slides for the talk can be downloaded below: libslub libslub can be downloaded from here. Abstract The abstract for the talk was as follows: Over the last year the Exploit Development [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: OffensiveCon 2023 ‚Äì Exploit Engineering ‚Äì Attacking the Linux Kernel

articles.author: chrisanley
articles.description: Code Credential Scanner is a new open source tool designed to detect hardcoded credentials, or credentials present in configuration files within a repository. These represent a serious security issue, and can be extremely hard to detect and manage. The tool is intended to be used directly by dev teams in a CI/CD pipeline, to manage [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Tool Release: Code Credential Scanner (ccs)

articles.author: Jose Selvi
articles.description: In the following blog post, we explore how overfitting can affect Large Language Models (LLMs) in particular, since this technology is used in the most promising AI technologies we see today (chatGPT, LLaMa, Bard, etc). Furthermore, by exploring the likelihood of inferring data from the dataset, we will determine how much we can trust these [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Exploring Overfitting Risks in Large Language Models

articles.author: Marie-Sarah Lacharite
articles.description: You may have heard of RSA (b. 1977), but have you heard of its cousin, Paillier (b. 1999)? In this post, we provide a close look at the Paillier homomorphic encryption scheme [Paillier1999], what it offers, how it‚Äôs used in complex protocols, and how to implement it securely. Contents RSA Encryption Refresher and Notation We‚Äôll [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: The Paillier Cryptosystem with Applications to Threshold ECDSA

articles.author: Eric Schorn
articles.description: This blog post presents a whirlwind overview of Verifiable Random Functions (VRFs) as used by several leading-edge blockchains, and shows how a very interesting and recently found implementation oversight causes the VRF‚Äôs assurance of uniqueness to fall apart. As VRFs are commonly used for selecting blockchain consensus voting committees, this can result in a rigged [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Rigging the Vote: Uniqueness in Verifiable Random Functions

articles.author: Jameson Hyde
articles.description: Medical device security is gaining more attention for several reasons. The conversation often gets connected to device safety, that is, the degree to which the risk of patient harm is limited by preventing or controlling for device malfunction. Device security expands the scope of safety by supposing a malicious attacker is causing or exploiting the [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Medical Devices: A Hardware Security Perspective

articles.description: A detailed analysis on multiple vulnerabilities which were identified on the NETGEAR Nighthawk WiFi 6 Router (RAX AX2400) and may exist on other NETGEAR router models.
articles.title: NETGEAR Routers: A Playground for Hackers?

articles.author: Kevin Henry
articles.description: The annual Real World Cryptography Conference organized by the IACR recently took place in Tokyo, Japan. On top of 3 days of excellent talks, RWC was preceded by the 2nd annual FHE.org Conference and the Real World Post-Quantum Cryptography Workshop and followed by the High Assurance Crypto Software Workshop. Nearly all of NCC Group‚Äôs Cryptography [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Real World Cryptography Conference 2023 ‚Äì Part I

articles.author: John Redford
articles.description: In the last calendar quarter of 2022, Amazon Web Services (AWS) engaged NCC Group to conduct an architecture review of the AWS Nitro System design, with focus on specific claims AWS made for the security of the Nitro System APIs. The public report for this review may be downloaded below:
articles.title: Public Report ‚Äì¬†AWS Nitro System API & Security Claims

articles.author: Roger Meyer
articles.description: Different forms of DNS rebinding attacks have been described as far back as 1996 for Java Applets and 2002 for JavaScript (Quick-Swap). It has been four years since our State of DNS Rebinding presentation in 2019 at DEF CON 27 (slides), where we introduced our DNS rebinding attack framework Singularity of Origin. In 2020, we [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: State of DNS Rebinding in 2023

articles.author: Emmaline
articles.description:
Attack Surface Management (ASM) tools find quite a lot of vulnerabilities on the Web. This really isn‚Äôt surprising, given that HTTP/S is by far the most common and broadest of all the services comprising the Internet. In fact, Web-based issues represent the majority of the findings about which our Managed Service Providers (MSPs) inform our [‚Ä¶]
The post Content Discovery: Understanding Your Web Attack Surface appeared first on Praetorian.
articles.title: Content Discovery: Understanding Your Web Attack Surface

articles.author: Emmaline
articles.description:
Chariot is more than a product; it‚Äôs a partnership that combines automated monitoring and human analysis to identify externally-accessible security risks. In light of the FDA‚Äôs latest requirements for in-market device security (summarized in Section 524B), Praetorian‚Äôs customers are having success leveraging the Chariot Managed Service as a cost-effective and scalable approach to satisfying Section [‚Ä¶]
The post In Brief: Chariot Alignment with FDA Section 524B.1 appeared first on Praetorian.
articles.title: In Brief: Chariot Alignment with FDA Section 524B.1

articles.author: Emmaline
articles.description:
The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) recently released the latest draft of the Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) 2.0, incorporating numerous updates and improvements over its predecessor. Among these changes, the addition of the Governance function has generated significant buzz within the cybersecurity community. We also are particularly excited about the modification of subcategories in [‚Ä¶]
The post Measuring People, Process, and Technology Effectiveness with NIST CSF 2.0 appeared first on Praetorian.
articles.title: Measuring People, Process, and Technology Effectiveness with NIST CSF 2.0

articles.author: Emmaline
articles.description:
As Phil Venables has said, ‚Äúat some level, cyber defense is a battle over whether the attacker or defender has better visibility of the target. Action is key, yes, but without good ‚Äòcyber cartography‚Äô it can be hard to act in the right way.‚Äù An attacker‚Äôs first step is enumeration, or identifying what looks hackable. [‚Ä¶]
The post Cyber Cartography: Mapping a Target appeared first on Praetorian.
articles.title: Cyber Cartography: Mapping a Target

articles.description:
As more companies develop in-house services and tools to moderate access to production environments, the importance of understanding and testing these Zero Touch Production (ZTP) platforms grows 1 2. This blog post aims to provide an overview of ZTP tools and services, explore their security role in DevSecOps, and outline common pitfalls to watch out for when testing them.
SRE? ZTP?    
Safe Proxies In Production
The safety & security roles of Safe Proxies
What does ZTP look like today
What to look for when auditing ZTP tools/services    
A. Web Attack Surface
B. Hooks
C. Safe Centralization
D. Insecure Default Templates
E. Logging
F. Rate-limiting
G. ACL Ownership
H. Command Safeguards
I. Traceability and Scoping
J. Scoped Access
K. Different Interfaces, Different Requirements
L. Service ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Testing Zero Touch Production Platforms and Safe Proxies

articles.author: pi3
articles.description: At first, I didn‚Äôt plan to write an article about the problems with bug bounty programs. This was supposed to be a standard technical blogpost describing an interesting bug in the Linux Kernel i915 driver allowing for a linear Out-Of-Bound read and write access (CVE-2023-28410). Moreover, I‚Äôm not even into bug bounty programs, mostly because [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Bug bounties are broken ‚Äì the story of ‚Äúi915‚Äù bug, ChromeOS + Intel bounty programs, and beyond

articles.author: William Woodruff
articles.description: Read the official announcement on the PyPI blog as well! For the past year, we‚Äôve worked with the Python Package Index to add a new, more secure authentication method called ‚Äútrusted publishing.‚Äù Trusted publishing eliminates the need for long-lived API tokens and passwords, reducing the risk of supply chain attacks and credential leaks while also [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Trusted publishing: a new benchmark for packaging security

articles.author: Trail of Bits
articles.description: Last month, hundreds of cryptographers descended upon Tokyo for the first Real World Crypto Conference in Asia. As in previous years, we dispatched a handful of our researchers and engineers to present and attend the conference. What sets RWC apart from other conferences is that it strongly emphasizes research, collaborations, and advancements in cryptography that [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Real World Crypto 2023 Recap

articles.author: Trail of Bits
articles.description: By Yarden Shafir, Senior Security Engineer WNF (Windows Notification Facility) is an undocumented notification mechanism that allows communication inside processes, between processes, or between user mode processes and kernel drivers. Similar to other notification mechanisms like ETW (Event Tracing for Windows) and ALPC (Advanced Local Procedure Call), WNF communication happens over different ‚Äúchannels,‚Äù each representing [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Introducing Windows Notification Facility‚Äôs (WNF) Code Integrity

articles.author: Exodus Intel VRT
articles.description:
By¬†Javier Jimenez Overview This post describes a method of exploiting a race condition in the V8 JavaScript engine, version 9.1.269.33. The vulnerability affects the following versions of Chrome and Edge: Google Chrome versions between 90.0.4430.0 and 91.0.4472.100. Microsoft Edge versions between 90.0.818.39 and 91.0.864.41. The vulnerability occurs when one of the TurboFan jobs generates a ... Read more Google Chrome V8 ArrayShift Race Condition Remote Code Execution
The post Google Chrome V8 ArrayShift Race Condition Remote Code Execution appeared first on Exodus Intelligence.
articles.title: Google Chrome V8 ArrayShift Race Condition Remote Code Execution

articles.author: Exodus Intel VRT
articles.description: In the contemporary digital landscape, vulnerability management teams and analysts are overwhelmed by countless alerts, data streams, and patch recommendations. The sheer volume of information is daunting and frequently misleading. Ideally, the systems generating these alerts should streamline and prioritize the information. While AI systems and products are not yet mature enough to effectively filter ... Read more Why Choose Exodus Intelligence for Enhanced Vulnerability Management?¬† The post Why Choose Exodus Intelligence for Enhanced Vulnerability Management?¬† appeared first on Exodus Intelligence.
articles.title: Why Choose Exodus Intelligence for Enhanced Vulnerability Management?

articles.author: Wolfgang Sommergut
articles.description:
Windows has three types of network profiles: domain, private, and public. The former is automatically assigned to all computers that are members of an AD domain, and this cannot be changed. On the other hand, you can switch between private and public to activate the associated security settings.
Change Windows network profiles between public and private first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Change Windows network profiles between public and private

articles.author: Michael Pietroforte
articles.description:
There is no denying that Google has been the most crucial resource for IT professionals for the past two decades. Most IT professionals are adept problem solvers, and there are only a handful of IT issues that cannot be resolved by the vast resources of the internet. As AI-powered search engines continue to emerge, a question arises: will Google be replaced by GPT-4-based chatbots and search engines like chatGPT and Bing Chat?
Poll: How reliable are chatGPT and Bing Chat? first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Poll: How reliable are chatGPT and Bing Chat?

articles.author: Surender Kumar
articles.description:
Previously, I discussed built-in snapshots and backup features in Proxmox VE. Today, I will have a look at Proxmox Backup Server. Proxmox Backup Server is an enterprise-ready backup and recovery solution for VMs, containers, and physical servers.¬†It supports deduplicated and incremental backups to reduce network load and increase storage efficiency.
Proxmox Backup Server: Install and configure first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Proxmox Backup Server: Install and configure

articles.author: Jasmin Kahriman
articles.description:
Windows 11 S mode builds on its predecessor, Windows 10 S mode. It is a streamlined version of Windows 11, designed to provide a secure, fast, and easy-to-use computing experience. In this article, we will explore the key features and benefits of Windows 11 S mode and compare them to Windows 10 S mode. In addition, you will learn how to disable Windows 11 S mode.
What is Windows 10 S mode? How does Windows 11 S mode differ? first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: What is Windows 10 S mode? How does Windows 11 S mode differ?

articles.author: Brandon Lee
articles.description:
Discover the Pulseway 9.2 update, offering enhanced IT management features, such as policy redesign, workflow automation improvements, remote control enhancements, and more.
Pulseway 9.2: Remote monitoring with workflow automation first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Pulseway 9.2: Remote monitoring with workflow automation

articles.author: Wolfgang Sommergut
articles.description:
If you want to assign a drive letter to file shares via the command line, you can use PowerShell instead of net.exe. The SmbShare module's cmdlets can display, connect, and disconnect shared drives. PowerShell also supports newer SMB features, such as QUIC and Compression.
How to map a network drive with PowerShell first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: How to map a network drive with PowerShell

articles.author: Brandon Lee
articles.description:
ENow Active Directory Monitoring & Reporting provides quick, granular visibility into your Active Directory environment so IT pros can proactively mitigate issues before they escalate into major problems for your organization.
ENow Active Directory Monitoring & Reporting first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: ENow Active Directory Monitoring & Reporting

articles.author: Surender Kumar
articles.description:
To access remote storage from Docker containers, you must understand how Docker works with network-attached storage (NAS) and the Network File System (NFS) protocol. In this guide, I will explore the benefits of using Docker with NAS and NFS, and then I will explain how to set up an NFS share to access it from a Docker container. For demonstration, I will use TrueNAS with NFSv4.
Using Docker with NAS and NFS first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Using Docker with NAS and NFS

articles.author: Graham Beer
articles.description:
Back in 2020 at the AWS annual learning conference, re:Invent, one of the big announcements concerned AWS Lambda container image support for Docker and the Open Container Initiative (OCI). AWS Lambda, as a service, has always been popular, with its simple process of uploading code and not having to worry about provisioning servers. However, you might be a company that is invested in container technology, and it is not so easy to utilize Lambda. With the support for Lambda functions with container images, you can now enjoy this functionality.
Using AWS Lambda functions with Docker containers first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Using AWS Lambda functions with Docker containers

articles.author: Brandon Lee
articles.description:
NTLM is an insecure authentication protocol that is still found in many environments. Using Group Policy and effective logging, admins can audit the environment and restrict the use of NTLM across the domain.
Auditing and restricting NTLM authentication using Group Policy first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Auditing and restricting NTLM authentication using Group Policy

articles.author: Brandon Lee
articles.description:
ScriptRunner provides a centralized management interface for PowerShell scripts, allowing users, even with little or no scripting experience, to automate IT tasks. The most recent release, ScriptRunner Portal Edition R5, introduces many new refinements to the platform, including the introduction of Query and Action configuration into the portal.
ScriptRunner Portal Edition R5‚ÄîNew Query configuration and Action configuration first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: ScriptRunner Portal Edition R5‚ÄîNew Query configuration and Action configuration

articles.author: Jasmin Kahriman
articles.description:
This guide drives you through the procedure of moving a VM from XenServer to a Hyper-V running on Windows Server 2022 with the free tool StarWind V2V Converter. For a guest OS, we use Windows Server 2019.
Move a VM from XenServer to Hyper-V with StarWind V2V Converter first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Move a VM from XenServer to Hyper-V with StarWind V2V Converter

articles.author: Edem Afenyo
articles.description:
In my previous post, I introduced Traefik as a cloud-native way to implement a reverse proxy and load balancer for your containers. In this post, you will get a bit more hands-on, learning the ins and outs of installing and configuring Traefik as a reverse proxy in your Docker environment.
Install and configure Traefik on Docker first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Install and configure Traefik on Docker

articles.author: Surender Kumar
articles.description:
The Proxmox cluster provides a centralized interface for managing your data center's processing, storage, networking, and other resources. Furthermore, it provides easier VM/container migration across nodes and high availability to ensure ongoing service in the event of cluster node failure. Cluster management in Proxmox VE is handled by the Proxmox VE cluster manager (pvecm).
Create a Proxmox cluster first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Create a Proxmox cluster

articles.author: Wolfgang Sommergut
articles.description:
If a virtual machine (VM) in a VMware workstation cannot establish a connection to other VMs or the internet, then you should check the settings in the guest operating system, in the virtual network, and in the adapter configuration of the host OS. Both NAT and bridged networks can be affected by such problems.
Troubleshooting no network or internet in VMware Workstation first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Troubleshooting no network or internet in VMware Workstation

articles.author: Brandon Lee
articles.description:
With Windows Server 2012 and 2012 R2 reaching their end of life at the end of 2023, organizations must consider migrating their Remote Desktop Services (RDS) deployments from Windows Server 2012 to 2022. When doing so, you have to follow a distinct order to upgrade the RDS roles. By migrating the connection broker, you keep the configuration of the deployment.
Upgrade Windows Server 2012 RDS first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Upgrade Windows Server 2012 RDS

articles.author: Jasmin Kahriman
articles.description:
By default, Windows 11 requires a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) chip to be present on the computer. However, it is possible to enable BitLocker on Windows 11 without TPM if you jump through a few hoops.
Enable BitLocker on Windows 11 without a TPM chip first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Enable BitLocker on Windows 11 without a TPM chip

articles.author: Wolfgang Sommergut
articles.description:
nslookup has established itself as a popular tool for troubleshooting DNS problems. It exists on multiple platforms, including Windows. However, there is an alternative, the PowerShell Resolve-DnsName cmdlet, which can also check proprietary Microsoft protocols for name resolution, such as NetBIOS or LLMNR.
Resolve-DnsName: nslookup for PowerShell first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Resolve-DnsName: nslookup for PowerShell

articles.author: Mohammed Kaif Joey
articles.description:
Endpoints such as laptops, desktops, and mobile devices are vulnerable to cyberattacks, which can compromise sensitive data and cause serious damage to the organization. To address this challenge, Microsoft has developed Intune Endpoint Privilege Management, a solution that enables organizations to secure their endpoints by controlling and managing user access and permissions. This blog post aims to assist you in setting up Endpoint Privilege Management (EPM) in your organization so that your users can maintain their productivity while ensuring that security is not compromised.
Security with Intune: Endpoint Privilege Management first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Security with Intune: Endpoint Privilege Management

articles.author: Surender Kumar
articles.description:
By default, Docker containers are ephemeral, which means that any data generated or modified within a container is lost when the container is stopped or removed. Docker volumes allow you to create persistent storage outside the container, which can be accessed and shared by multiple containers.
Move a Docker volume to another host first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Move a Docker volume to another host

articles.author: Brandon Lee
articles.description:
Microsoft LAPS is a solution for centrally managing passwords for local administrator accounts in an Active Directory domain. It includes a native Windows GUI to retrieve LAPS-controlled passwords. However, the free LAPS WebUI allows you to access passwords from every browser without installing local software.
Retrieve local admin passwords from Active Directory with LAPS WebUI first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Retrieve local admin passwords from Active Directory with LAPS WebUI

articles.author: Brandon Lee
articles.description:
Group Policy admins have to deal with a lot of different ADMX templates. These templates are not limited to the operating system, but are also necessary for many applications, such as Adobe Reader, Firefox, Chrome, and OneDrive. Since they are updated on a regular basis, admins must check for new versions and copy them manually to the respective directory. EvergreenAdmx can automate this process.
Update ADMX templates automatically with EvergreenAdmx first appeared on 4sysops.
articles.title: Update ADMX templates automatically with EvergreenAdmx

articles.author: adam
articles.description: Pretty much all of my DeXRAY posts ever published been focusing on new versions of this tool being released. Today I will talk about the ‚Äòmaking of the sausages‚Äô part [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: DeXRAY, DFIR, and the art of ambulance chasing‚Ä¶

articles.description: A decade ago blue teaming was ‚Ä¶ easy (this is a really bad joke, I know!). In fairness, we had less targets, less programming languages to deal with, less platforms, [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Blue teaming ‚Äì it‚Äôs DATa complicated‚Ä¶

articles.author: adam
articles.description: I love looking at clusters of files, because it‚Äôs the easiest way to find patterns. In the last part of this series I focused on Nullsoft installers (DLLs!) only, and [‚Ä¶]
articles.title: Da Li‚ÄôL World of DLL Exports and Entry Points, Part 6

articles.title: Matlab persistent lolbin ‚Äì 2 years too late, but always‚Ä¶

articles.author: adam
articles.description: In my previous posts I have listed many PE sections present in different types of binaries. Today I am looking at win11 PE sections and am happy to report that [‚Ä¶]

articles.description: FOR589: Dark Web Threat Hunting & Blockchain Forensics course teaches students how to hunt for threat intelligence within the cybercriminal underground using Human Intelligence (HUMINT) elicitation techniques and blockchain analytics tools to trace criminal cryptocurrency transactions. Following the completion of the course, each student will be prepared to social engineer cybercriminals, produce dark web intelligence, provide unique intelligence support to incident response cases, extract cryptocurrency artifacts from mobile and computer devices, negotiate with ransomware operators on behalf of a client, support Law Enforcement partners with attribution efforts, and investigate Anti-Money Laundering (AML) cases involving cryptocurrency transactions on and off the Blockchain.
articles.title: FOR589: Cybercrime Intelligence

articles.description: I‚Äôm in the¬†digital forensics (DF) of the DFIR, the Incident Response (IR) group approach to this action would be very different. How may our actions differ? The (IR) group may be more concerned about when is the next pallet of bananas going to arrive or how does the store quell the panic when only standard bananas are available because of the organics being sold out? In the meantime, I‚Äôm standing only focused on this pallet, or maybe only the bananas I‚Äôm holding. My lifetime of eating and cyber training tells me that I am correct, but not limited to many steps in my investigation.
articles.title: The Banana Incident

articles.description: In digital forensics you need to know who was involved so you can begin your data collection. Best to collect every piece of hardware you can, this will allow you to start your acquisition of data from each device. When you‚Äôre at the kitchen table, keep your cards close to your chest, but in the digital world, that means ensuring you preserve the integrity of your evidence.
articles.title: The game of CLUE

articles.description:
This post shows how a malicious website can take control of a ChatGPT chat session and exfiltrate the history of the conversation.
Plugins, Tools and Integrations With plugins, data exfiltration can happen by sending too much data into the plugin in the first place. More security controls and insights on what is being sent to the plugin are required to empower users.
However, this post is not about sending too much data to a plugin, but about a malicious actor who controls the data a plugin retrieves.
articles.title: ChatGPT Plugins: Data Exfiltration via Images & Cross Plugin Request Forgery

articles.description:
As discussed previously the problem of Indirect Prompt Injections is increasing.
They start showing up in many places.
A new unique one that I ran across is YouTube transcripts. ChatGPT (via Plugins) can access YouTube transcripts. Which is pretty neat. However, as expected (and predicted by many researches) all these quickly built tools and integrations introduce Indirect Prompt Injection vulnerabilities.
Proof of Concept Here is how it looks with ChatGPT end to end with a demo example.
articles.title: Indirect Prompt Injection via YouTube Transcripts

articles.description:
To learn more about Prompt Engineering and Prompt Injections I put together this tutorial + lab for myself. It is as a Jupyter Notebook to experiement and play around with this novel attack technique, learn and experiment.
The examples reach from simple prompt engineering scenarios, such as changing the output message to a specific text, to more complex adversarial prompt challenges such as JSON object injection, HTML injection/XSS, overwriting mail recipients or orders of an OrderBot and also data exfiltration.
articles.title: Adversarial Prompting: Tutorial and Lab

articles.description:
There are many prompt engineering classes and currently pretty much all examples are vulnerable to Prompt Injections. Especially Indirect Prompt Injections are dangerous as we discussed before.
Indirect Prompt Injections allow untrusted data to take control of the LLM (large language model) and give an AI a new instructions, mission and objective.
Bypassing Input Validation Attack payloads are natural language. This means there are lots of creative ways an adversary can inject malicious data that bypass input filters and web application firewalls.
articles.title: Video: Prompt Injections - An Introduction

articles.description:
Hack and protect Machine Learning Systems so that we don‚Äôt get stuck in the matrix!
It‚Äôs been almost three years since I started the Machine Learning Attack Series, and my interest in attacking and leveraging AI and Machine Learning is unbroken.
There is so much to learn and explore, particularly in bridging the gap between traditional security engineering and machine learning. As followers of this blog will know, this is an area I have been exploring in-depth over the past few years.
articles.title: MLSecOps Podcast: AI Red Teaming and Threat Modeling Machine Learning Systems

It has been applied to cooperation during war, to trade and commerce, and even to intelligence sharing. That special relationship has clearly influenced the two nations‚Äô recent policy papers on national cybersecurity. The U.K. [‚Ä¶]
